metadata.title: Optimizing your widget for accented rendering mode and Liquid Glass
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Apple Developer documentation explaining how to optimize widgets for Liquid Glass material and accented rendering mode. Covers the three rendering modes (fullColor, accented, vibrant), the widgetAccentable modifier for grouping views, and WidgetAccentedRenderingMode options for image rendering.

liquidGlass.definition: A dynamic, adaptive material used by iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Watch that also applies to widgets
liquidGlass.triggerCondition: When a person chooses a tinted or clear appearance for their Home Screen

systemBehaviors.behavior: Renders widget in accented rendering mode
Tints primary and accented content white
Tints primary content white and accented content in watch face color
Tints opaque images with a single white color
Maintains opacity for transparent content and gradients, tints them white
Removes background and replaces with themed glass or tinted color effect

implementationSteps.detail: Reserve rich visual content for non-tinted appearances

implementationSteps.action: Adjust widget layout as needed for accented rendering mode
implementationSteps.detail: Ensure text readability and visual harmony with Liquid Glass

implementationSteps.action: Group views into primary and accent groups using widgetAccentable(_:) view modifier

implementationSteps.action: Configure image rendering using WidgetAccentedRenderingMode view modifier
implementationSteps.detail: Choose appropriate rendering mode for each image

bestPractices.tip: Using accented, desaturated, or accentedDesaturated rendering modes helps the widget fit the system's cohesive look on the Home Screen
bestPractices.recommendation: Reserve the fullColor rendering mode for images that represent media content, such as album artwork or a book cover
